Department: Lee Kuan Yew School Of Public Policy
ModuleDescription: This course addresses a number of cutting-edge issues in the international economic policy area. It addresses issues in the real trade area related in, particular, to the interaction between the economic and political dimensions of trade policy, the recent shifts from multilateral approaches to trade liberalization towards regional and bilateral approaches, and the status of the Doha Trade Round. Even though the focus of the course will be on global issues, extensive examples will be provided from Asia and the course will consider how the region is responding to the challenges of globalization, including in the context of he “New Asian Regionalism”.
